div.p: Conroe ISD is closed in accordance with Governor Abbott’s directive on April 17, 2020. The remainder of Conroe ISD’s academic year will be completed through distance learning.

Conroe ISD is a community of individuals working together to achieve the best for students. The District is proud of the accomplishments of the students, teachers, and administrators who have helped make it a great place to be!

div.h3: Online registration for the 2020-2021 school year opened Saturday, April 18th.

a.span: Find your neighborhood school and view registration information.

div.p: Deane L. Sadler Administration Building @ 7:30 AM
Deane L. Sadler Administration Building @ 6:00 PM
Deane L. Sadler Administration Building @ 6:00 PM

The Conroe Independent School District (District) is an equal opportunity educational provider and employer does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, religion, age, or disability in educational programs or activities that it operates or in employment matters. The District is required by Title VI and Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, the Age Discrimination Act of 1975, as amended, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Americans with Disabilities Act, as well as Board policy not to discriminate in such a manner. For information about Title IX rights or Section 504/ADA rights, contact the Title IX coordinator or the Section 504/ADA coordinator.

hr.p: In accordance with Education Code 37.105 and District’s Code of Conduct, the District has the right to refuse entry to or eject a person from property under the District's control if the person refuses to leave peaceably upon request. Please see Conroe ISD - Code of Conduct.

div.p:
District Office Hours:
Monday - Friday
8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m.
